thread.title: A hint for Monica Wehby: Your new PAC is far from transparent (Letters to the Editor)
thread.title_full: A hint for Monica Wehby: Your new PAC is far from transparent (Letters to the Editor) | OregonLive.com

author: Letters to the editor
title: A hint for Monica Wehby: Your new PAC is far from transparent (Letters to the Editor)
text:
Monica PAC: Regarding "Wehby's new breed of PAC," (Sept. 20): Monica Wehby warns us that Monica PAC is "an operation the likes of which Oregon has never seen." It seems this operation consists of an opaque business structure that raises money from an unsuspecting public to provide a "service" or "product" of questionable value while enriching the principals.
The organization, while committed to rooting out corruption, features a failed political candidate who enriched herself by performing a surgery that had marginal benefits and came under the criticism of her peers, a CEO who is litigation happy and has trouble paying his bills, and an in-house counsel and accountant who will vouch that his arrangements are not illegal.
We have seen this is Oregon before, especially with Ted Sizemore and Cylvia Hayes. Here's a hint for Wehby: Byzantine structures are not good for transparency, and "not illegal" is a very low bar to set for someone who wishes to root out corruption.
James Johnson
Northeast Portland
